WPS::archives.description:
Get an array of archives links depending on the passed arguments.
The arguments are the same as the one of the `wp_get_archives` wordpress function.

WPS::categories.description: Retrieve back the categories of your wordpress installation.

WPS::comment_remove_url_field.description: Remove the url field from the comment form

WPS::comments.description:
Get the post comments depending on the arguments you've passed.
The arguments are the same as the one of `get_comments` wordpress function.
This function return an array of \WPS\Comment objects.

WPS::recent_comments.description:
Get some recent comments depending on the arguments you've passed.
The arguments are the same as the one of `get_comments` wordpress function.
This function return an array of WPS_Comment objects.

WPS::add_featured_image_support.description: Add featured image support for your theme

WPS::jpg_quality.description: Change the default JPG quality compression setting

WPS::add_mime_types.description: Add mime types to the authorized upload ones

WPS::remove_mime_types.description: Remove some mime types supported for upload

WPS::menu.description:
Get back the requested menu in object format. Each item is a WPS\Menu_Item object
that can contains the sub-item depending on the menu structure.
This function is very usefull to create simple as well as complexe menu without the
weird wordpress menu functions. Here you have the raw menu structured
in an array of objects that you can use to generate your menu easily.

WPS::pagination.description:
Get back an array of pagination items. A pagination item is made of:
- `is_prev` : true/false if the item is the "previous" link
- `is_next` : true/false if the item is the "next" link
- `is_current` : true/false if the item it the current one
- `url` : the url of the page
- `label` : the label of the link

WPS::next_post.description: Get the next posts in WPS\Post format

WPS::next_posts_link.description: Get the next posts link in object format containing the url and the label property.

WPS::next_posts_url.description: Get back the next posts url

WPS::popular_posts.description:
Retrieve some popular posts depending on the args passed.
The args are the same as the one passed to the `get_posts` wordpress function.

This function need the use of the `WPS::count_post_views` one to count the times a post is viewed.
Simply call the `WPS:count_post_views()` inside your `functions.php`.

WPS::post.description: Retrieve a specific post in \WPS\Post format

WPS::posts.description:
Retrieve some posts depending on the args passed.
The args are the same as the one passed to the `get_posts` wordpress function.

WPS::previous_post.description: Get the previous posts in WPS\Post format

WPS::previous_posts_link.description: Get the previous posts link in object format containing the url and the label property.

WPS::previous_posts_url.description: Get back the previous posts url

WPS::recent_posts.description:
Get some recent posts depending on the arguments you've passed.
The arguments are the same as the one of `wp_get_recent_posts` wordpress function.
This function return an array of WPS\Post objects.

WPS::search_results_per_page.description: Set the number of results to display on the search results page

WPS::user.description: Get a user by id/email and return it in WPS\User format

WPS::users_count.description: Get the number of registered users in the DB

WPS::count_post_views.description:
Count the number of views on each posts (pages, etc...).
This function will add and maintain a post meta value called `post_viewed` that you can use later for to make queries.

WPS::disable_admin_bar.description: Disable the admin bar in the frontend

WPS::remove_version.description: Remove the wordpress version in the metas tags

WPS::session_start.description: Start a session if not already done
